intro: Eurycoma, commonly known as the Malayan dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rutaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia and Indonesia, and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and yellow flowers, which bloom in clusters. Eurycoma species are often found in forested areas and are adapted to moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and ecosystem.
